text: Samuel Moore Walton (March 29, 1918 â€“ April 5, 1992) was an American businessman. Walton created the well-known American stores, Wal-Mart and Sam's Club. Walton was born to Thomas Gibson Walton and Nancy Lee Walton. He was part of the Walton family, which is one of the richest families in the world. Walton died on April 6, 1992. He died a billionaire but was known for driving a pickup truck instead of an expensive car. He also had a military career during WW2. He had joined the U.S. Army Intelligence Corps. ==References== Category:1918 births Category:1992 deaths Category:American billionaires Category:Businesspeople from Arkansas Category:Deaths from multiple myeloma Category:Cancer deaths in Arkansas Category:Businesspeople from Oklahoma
title: Sam Walton
